subject: Web3
title: Waste Management Tracking
description: A quick, practical guide to Waste Management Tracking.

hook.text: Millions of tons of recyclable waste end up in landfills because tracking systems fail. Blockchain can close the gap.

buildup.text: Plastic Bank uses blockchain to track recycled plastic from collection in developing countries to manufacturing.

discovery.text: Collectors earn digital tokens for each kilogram of plastic they bring in. The blockchain records every transaction.

twist.text: Companies buying the recycled plastic can verify its origin. Greenwashing becomes much harder with a transparent chain.

climax.text: Blockchain waste tracking creates economic incentives for recycling while proving environmental claims are real.

punchline.text: Track every piece of plastic from ocean to product. Blockchain makes it verifiable.

quiz.question: How does Plastic Bank use blockchain?
options: To track and verify recycled plastic from collection to manufacturing
